intro: Muscarella sibatensis, commonly known as the Sibatensis muscaria, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered at the base of the plant. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
